After you finish your undergraduate training and are accepted to medical school, you begin medical training. Medical school is a four year program. The first two years are spent in classrooms and lecture halls, and you will learn the fundamentals of the human body, disease, pharmacology, and body systems.

Physicians and surgeons have demanding education and training requirements. Almost all physicians complete at least 4 years of undergraduate school, 4 years of medical school, and, depending on their specialty, 3 to 8 years in internship and residency programs.
